sentence.Network_en: The more recent conifer plantations cannot yet compare with the old woodlands.
sentence.Network_cn: 年代较近的针叶树林场还比不上年代久远的林场。

sentence.Network_en: In conifer orchards new stumps should be removed.
sentence.Network_cn: 在针叶树的种子园,新的伐桩应予除掉.

sentence.Network_en: Conifer tree style such as pine, fir, spruce, redwood, juniper, etc.
sentence.Network_cn: 针叶类树包括松树 、 杉树 、 云杉 、 红木 、 刺柏, 等等.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 19th cent.: from Latin, literally cone-bearing', from conus (see cone)

entry.def: Conifers are a group of trees and shrubs, for example pine trees and fir trees, that grow in cooler areas of the world. They have fruit called cones, and very thin leaves called needles which they do not normally lose in winter.

means.word_mean: 1. any gymnospermous tree or shrub bearing cones

auth_sentence.content: Some predatory mammals have also benefited from these conifer plantations.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Some predatory mammals have also benefited from these conifer plantations.

auth_sentence.content: Conifer forests look very white from above when covered by snow.

of一再+fer带来,拿来→一再带来→提供
offer[v.提供,提议,出现 n.出价,提议,意图]+ing表名词→n.报盘,提供的货物

sentences.en: Firs, spruces and pines are conifers.
sentences.cn: 冷杉、云杉和松树都是针叶树。
